org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.aneka

Class AnekaWebServices

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.aneka.AnekaWebServices

  • public class AnekaWebServices
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for accessing the Aneka Web Services. First action after creation must be authenticateUser(String, String) that authenticates the user and saves the provided token. After that, a new application must be created using createApplication* methods. The id of the latest created application will be stored and used when no application id is provided. Within the new application, jobs can be submitted to Aneka using #submitJob* methods. Last, when the application is no longer needed, it may be aborted using abortApplication(String).
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

        debug - true to enable debug, false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticateUser

        public boolean authenticateUser(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
        Authenticates in the API using the given credentials. Access token is stored in mUserCredential. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError().
        Parameters:
        username - the Aneka username.
        password - the Aneka password.
        Returns:
        true if authentication was successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getError()

      • createApplication

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String createApplication(java.lang.String name,
                                                    ArrayOfFile sharedFiles,
                                                    StorageBucket... storageBuckets)
        Creates a new application with the given name, shared files and storage buckets. The latest created application id will be saved in defaultApplicationId, accessible through getDefaultApplicationId(). In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError(). NB: immediately after calling this method, the application will not already be ready to be used. You need to check its status before using it.
        Parameters:
        name - an arbitrary name for the new application.
        sharedFiles - shared files, if any, null otherwise.
        storageBuckets - storage buckets, if any.
        Returns:
        the application id if the application was submitted successfully, null otherwise.
        See Also:
        getError(), createApplicationWait(String, ArrayOfFile, StorageBucket...)

      • queryApplication

        @Nullable
public ApplicationResult queryApplication(java.lang.String applicationId)
        Queries application information for the given application id. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError().
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application.
        Returns:
        the retrieved ApplicationResult class if successful, null otherwise.
        See Also:
        getError()

public java.lang.String queryApplicationStatus(java.lang.String applicationId)

        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application.
        Returns:
        one of the constants in ApplicationStatus, representing the application status if API call was successful, null otherwise.
        See Also:
        getError()

        public boolean abortApplication(java.lang.String applicationId)

      • waitApplicationCreation

        public boolean waitApplicationCreation(java.lang.String applicationId)
        Waits for the application identified by the given applicationId to be ready to be used. This method calls queryApplicationStatus(String) every pollingPeriod milliseconds until the application is ready or after requestTimeout milliseconds have elapsed. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError().
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getError()

      • waitApplicationCreation

        public boolean waitApplicationCreation()
        Waits for the default application to be ready to be used.
        See Also:
        waitApplicationCreation(String)

      • createApplicationWait

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String createApplicationWait(java.lang.String name,
                                                        ArrayOfFile sharedFiles,
                                                        StorageBucket... storageBuckets)
        Creates a new application and waits for it to be ready. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError(). NB: this method will block the thread it is executing in.
        See Also:
        createApplication(String, ArrayOfFile, StorageBucket...), waitApplicationCreation(String)

        See Also:

      • submitJobs

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String[] submitJobs(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                              Job... jobs)
        Submits the given jobs to the application identified by the given applicationId. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError().
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application.
        jobs - the jobs to be submitted.
        Returns:
        an array of the same length as jobs containing the ids of the created jobs in the order they were given. If a job creation fails, its id will be null.

      • submitJobs

public java.lang.String[] submitJobs(Job... jobs)
        Submits the given jobs to the default application.
        See Also:
        submitJob(String, Job)

      • countNulls

        private int countNulls(java.lang.Object... objs)

      • submitJobsWait

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String[] submitJobsWait(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                                  Job... jobs)
        Submits the given jobs to the application identified by the given applicationId, retrying any failing jobs every pollingPeriod milliseconds up to a maximum time of requestTimeout milliseconds. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError().
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application.
        jobs - the jobs to be submitted.
        Returns:
        an array of the same length as jobs containing the ids of the created jobs in the order they were given. If a job creation fails, its id will be null.
        See Also:
        submitJobs(String, Job...)

      • submitJobsWait

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String[] submitJobsWait(Job... jobs)
        Submits the given jobs to the default, retrying any failing jobs every pollingPeriod milliseconds for a maximum time requestTimeout milliseconds.
        See Also:
        submitJobsWait(String, Job...)

public JobResult queryJob(java.lang.String applicationId,

        Queries all information about the given job. In case of error, the error message will be saved in the attribute error, accessible through getError().
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application the job runs in.
        jobId - the id of the job to query.
        Returns:
        the state of the job or null in case of error.

public java.lang.String queryJobStatus(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                                 java.lang.String jobId)

        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application the job runs in.
        jobId - the id of the job to query.
        Returns:
        one of the constants in JobStatus, representing the job status, if API call was successful. null otherwise.
        See Also:
        JobStatus

      • submitJobWait

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String submitJobWait(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                                Job job)
        Submits the given job to the application identified by the given applicationId, retrying every pollingPeriod milliseconds in case of failure up to a maximum time of requestTimeout milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application the job runs in.
        job - the job to be submitted.
        Returns:
        the id of the created job or null in case of error.
        See Also:
        submitJobsWait(String, Job...)

      • submitJobWait

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String submitJobWait(Job job)
        Submits the given job to the default application, retrying every pollingPeriod milliseconds in case of failure, up to a maximum time of requestTimeout milliseconds.
        See Also:
        submitJobWait(String, Job)

      • waitJobTermination

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String waitJobTermination(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                                     java.lang.String jobId)
        Waits for the given job termination for up to jobTimeout milliseconds, polling the Aneka server every pollingPeriod milliseconds. NB: this method will block the thread.
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the id of the application the job runs in.
        jobId - the id of the job to wait.
        Returns:
        one of the constants in JobStatus representing the job status, if API call was successful. null otherwise.

      • waitJobTermination

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String waitJobTermination(java.lang.String jobId)
        Waits for the given job termination for up to jobTimeout milliseconds, polling the Aneka server every pollingPeriod milliseconds. The job must be in the default application. NB: this method will block the thread.
        See Also:
        waitJobTermination(String, String)

      • getRequestTimeout

        public int getRequestTimeout()
        Returns the currently set request timeout.

      • setRequestTimeout

        public void setRequestTimeout(int requestTimeout)
        Sets a new request timeout in milliseconds. A value lower than or equal to 0 means no timeout at all. Default value is 5 seconds (5000).
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_REQUEST_TIMEOUT, waitApplicationCreation(String), submitJobsWait(String, Job...)

      • getJobTimeout

        public int getJobTimeout()
        Returns the currently set job timeout.

      • setJobTimeout

        public void setJobTimeout(int jobTimeout)
        Sets a new job timeout in milliseconds. A value lower than or equal to 0 means no timeout at all. Default value is 1 minute (60000).
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_JOB_TIMEOUT, waitJobTermination(String, String)

      • getPollingPeriod

        public int getPollingPeriod()
        Returns the currently set polling period.

      • setPollingPeriod

        public void setPollingPeriod(int pollingPeriod)
        Sets a new polling period in milliseconds. A value lower than or equal to 0 will result in back-to-back requests. Default value is half second (500).
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_POLLING_PERIOD, waitApplicationCreation(String), submitJobsWait(String, Job...), waitJobTermination(String, String)

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Returns true if this instance is authenticated, false otherwise.

        Returns true if the default application is set, false otherwise.
